title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to ratatouille
text: outlines propose change ratatouille. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to ratatouille
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ratatouille
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to ratatouille
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("riparias/rato-occurrences", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to ratatouille
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ratatouille
text: Please note ratatouille project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {ratatouille: Fetch Data from the RATO Database},   author = {Pieter Huybrechts},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.2.9000},   url = {https://github.com/inbo/ratatouille}, }

title: Fetch Data from the RATO Database
text: repository contains functionality access unprocessed data RATO vzw via API call ESRI ArcGIS instance. Credentials required access data. credentials stored github secrets RATO_USER RATO_PWD environmental parameters, can set locally editing .Renviron file.

what: Set Up your RATO credentials locally
title: Fetch Data from the RATO Database
text: easiest way store required username password necessary access RATO database storing .Renviron file. easy way edit file using function usethis package. contents file may contain secrets settings used scripts packages, can edited lines like: restarting R instance able fetch data RATO database without prompted credentials.
code: install.packages("usethis") usethis::edit_r_environ() RATO_USER = "RATO_INBO" RATO_PWD = "a super fake password that should be replaced by your real one"

title: Fetch Data from the RATO Database
text: can install development version ratatouille GitHub :

title: Fetch Data from the RATO Database
text: credentials stored, getting raw data RATO easy : resulting object looks like (many columns): example fields shown possibility personal data fields.
code: library(ratatouille) rato_data <- ratatouille() dplyr::slice_sample(rato_data, n = 5) |>   dplyr::select(dplyr::all_of(c("Soort", "Materiaal_Vast", "Materiaal_Consumptie", "Laatst_Bewerkt_Datum"))) |> knitr::kable()

title: Fetch Data from the RATO Database
text: raw data, cleaning required. Dutch names GBIF taxon ids provided, last often unchecked may contain errors.

what: Get objects from the RATO ArcGIS Enterprise environment via the API — get_objects
title: Get objects from the RATO ArcGIS Enterprise environment via the API — get_objects
text: function retrieves objects RATO ArcGIS environment based object_id. capable retrieving large amount objects single function call. minimize errors  fetch batch size number objects per request, operate parallel: maximum 5000 requests per 60 seconds, 10 requests open time.

title: Get objects from the RATO ArcGIS Enterprise environment via the API — get_objects
code: get_objects(   object_ids = list_object_ids(),   token = get_token(),   batch_size = 50 )

title: Get objects from the RATO ArcGIS Enterprise environment via the API — get_objects
text: object_ids Vector object_ids, converted character. token Access token, default generated get_token() batch_size Number objects request per API call, default 50. Setting lower number result API calls, also reduce risk timeouts errors requesting large datasets. set higher number, API may timeout return error dataset large.

title: Get objects from the RATO ArcGIS Enterprise environment via the API — get_objects
text: tibble requested objects.

text: credentials stored .Renviron file RATO_USER RATO_PWD. stored already function prompt store environmental variables. reset stored values,  pass emtpy strings "" either username password arguments.

title: Request an access token from the GIS API services — get_token
Request an access token from the GIS API services — get_token
text: username ArcGIS Enterprise username password ArcGIS Enterprise password

title: Request an access token from the GIS API services — get_token
text: Character. access token future API calls.

title: Request an access token from the GIS API services — get_token
text: default tokens expire every 5 minutes, cached expire. can set different expiry duration changing ratatouille.rato_expires_minutes option options()

title: Fetch raw invasive species data — ratatouille
ratatouille (development version)
text: Fixed bug RATO ArcGIS REST API returned error message part response object, ratatouille() fail cryptically parts query succeeded. (#50) # ratatouille 1.0.2 Fixed bug errors RATO ArcGIS REST API properly returned R errors, instead caused cryptic error without informative message. (#46) # ratatouille 1.0.1 magrittr longer direct dependency, package now uses base pipes |> internally. (#41) RATO REST API capacity can now set options() setting environmental variable RATO_API_CAPACITY. (#43) # ratatouille 1.0.0 Add ratatouille(), function fetch available invasive species data RATO single function call. (#36) functions now retry failed requests, fetching objects RATO ratatouille() throttle 1000 outstanding requests. (#36, #37) Add package wide options ratatouille.rato_expires_minutes, default 5 minutes ratatouille.cache_max_age_secs, default 150 seconds. allow easy modification cache behaviour. (#36)
